Activity – Standards Body Scavenger Hunt

The six standards organizations listed below are responsible for creating, developing, and monitoring many of the protocols/standards used in today’s communications world.

Click each of hyperlinks provided below. Read the page provided for each organization. Match the standards organization to its description (or function) by clicking in the appropriate cell.

1. <textformat blockindent='13'>Manages the DNS Root Zone standards and the .int registry.</textformat>
2. <textformat blockindent='13'>Creates standards for worldwide cabling infrastructure.</textformat>
3. <textformat blockindent='13'>Defines policies describing how "names and numbers“ of the Internet operate.</textformat>
4. <textformat blockindent='13'>Official standards products are RFC documents, published free of charge.</textformat>
5. <textformat blockindent='13'>Standards are developed using a six stage lifecycle diagram.</textformat>
6. <textformat blockindent='13'>Uses communications standards to predict famines and global climate changes.</textformat>
7. <textformat blockindent='13'>Supports "bridge the digital divide" initiatives. </textformat>
8. <textformat blockindent='13'>Creates standards for wired & wireless technologies.</textformat>
9. <textformat blockindent='13'>Serves as the central repository for protocol name and number registries.</textformat>
10. <textformat blockindent='21'>Offers online tools and resources for standards and developers.</textformat>
11. <textformat blockindent='21'>Provides wireless standards for IPTV.</textformat>
12. <textformat blockindent='21'>Coordinates unique international Internet addresses for site names & IP addresses.</textformat>
13. <textformat blockindent='21'>Standardizes the IP to Applications protocol layers.</textformat>
14. <textformat blockindent='21'>Supports navigation and online maps via radio/satellite transmissions.</textformat>
15. <textformat blockindent='21'>Provides a space where Internet protocols are set and maintained.</textformat>
16. <textformat blockindent='21'>Manages the DNS, IP addresses, and protocol identifier assignments.</textformat>
17. <textformat blockindent='21'>"Makes the Internet work better," using an engineering approach.</textformat>
18. <textformat blockindent='21'>Develops standards/protocols affecting cloud computing.</textformat>
19. <textformat blockindent='21'>Develops standards for homeland security/emergency response teams.</textformat>
